message: http://tasskr.com
/me like it. maybe have the option to keep the completed subtask still in the group rather than just bump everything to completed task list?

At first I thought I was missing the ability to have multiple lists, but I figure you can make subitems and solve this item. The only thing I am missing is that the graph are on another page. I'd like to see them all the time.
Lovely, but don't you think $4 is a bit much? BTW, make a mobile version for people like me
Looks good. The signup was quick and easy. It took me a little bit to 'get' the idea of the process bar, but I think it is a good idea implementing it like this, you'll actually know when to start :)
maybe use something like cssgrid.net for your design to work with smaller / mobile screen?
Thanks!  Planning on doing a mobile site, might try http://jquerymobile.com/
One feature that lots of todo apps lack is the ability to hide a task until x days before the due date.  Would really love if you could add this.
i'm adding it to the giant todo list of features to add

This is pretty awesome, somehow I always revert back to Google Tasks in my Gmail though. Probably because it's right there where everything else is...but I like how you keep it simply, keep doin that!
That's kind of why I started making it.  The other ones I found were way too complicated or featureless.  I'm trying to do simple+featureful.
@Danimal Mind, if you give me a free infinite license? lol
@Danimal looks nice
looks nice indeed

I love it. I have been using remember the milk for a while now, but I always find it too complicated, as you say, and the mobile app takes too long to navigate/edit. Pretty sure I'm switching already. The nested todos are brilliant - they do the same thing as rtm's lists, but you can see them all at once and organize them so much more easily with the drag and drop.
No problems using it on an iPhone, but I would appreciate a thinner mobile version too.
Awesome work. Feature idea: Notifo integration
possible bug -- email address used for login is case sensitive - this becomes an issue for those of us who sign up via iPhone which autocapitalizes the first letter.

I think pricing is off, would rather have a once yearly price. Just renewed RTM for $25. Am very hesitant to sign up for any service where I'm unsure that I'll be able to safely and easily (ie - no 20 minute begathon to an overseas operator) unsubscribe.

Unclear what tags add to functionality. Searching by #tag doesn't seem to do anything that searching by tag (without #) doesn't. Actually searching by #tag doesn't seem to work. I was expecting to click the tag and see a sorted list of some sort -- by tag.
